byline.original: By MICHAEL D. SHEAR and JULIA PRESTON

abstract: Conservative opposition has thwarted Pres Obama's plan to allow four million undocumented immigrants to remain in United States without threat of immediate deportation by stalling case in lower courts, preventing his executive actions from taking hold; even if case passes United States Court of Appeals for the Fifth Circuit in New Orleans it may not be considered by Supreme Court before end of Obama's term.
lead_paragraph: Nearly a year ago, the president vowed that his administration would provide up to four million undocumented immigrants the ability to live and work without fear of immediate deportation. Legal reviews are standing in the way.

headline.main: In Courts, Running Out the Clock on Obama Immigration Plan
headline.print_headline: In Courts, Running Out the Clock on Obama Immigration Plan

snippet: Nearly a year ago, the president vowed that his administration would provide up to four million undocumented immigrants the ability to live and work without fear of immediate deportation. Legal reviews are standing in the way.
